name: Boulevardier
description: This simple cocktail, basically a Negroni made with whiskey instead of gin, dates back to the late 1920s, but has recently enjoyed a comeback in bars across the country. It even inspired the name of the Dallas restaurant that supplied this recipe.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 ounce sweet vermouth, preferably Dolin Rouge
Twist of orange peel, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Chill a cocktail glass by filling with ice or putting in freezer for about 5 minutes.
Pour the liquid ingredients into a mixing glass. Fill mixing glass 2/3 full of ice and stir until chilled, about 30 seconds. Strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist.
